name: pressingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is urgent or needs to be dealt with immediately: most pressingly The industry is dealing with problems of its own, most pressingly the fast-approaching dates when the legal agreements come to an end.more pressingly Promoting public health means trying to achieve good health outcomes and, more pressingly, avoiding bad ones.
More examplesFewer examplesThere are still many questions about the organization of the festival that pressingly need answers.With the team's injuries, he will be pressingly needed for this week's match.
